Line 132: Line 132:
* In the [[Xbox 360]] and [[PlayStation 3]] versions of ''Grand Theft Auto IV'', when Niko drops off his girlfriend, if you choose to try your luck, Niko says, "perhaps I can join you for some 'hot coffee'."
* In the [[Xbox 360]] and [[PlayStation 3]] versions of ''Grand Theft Auto IV'', when Niko drops off his girlfriend, if you choose to try your luck, Niko says, "perhaps I can join you for some 'hot coffee'."
* In a seemingly further attempt to make light of the controversy, there is a chain of coffee shops in the ''Grand Theft Auto IV'' game called "Hot Coffee Shop"
* In a seemingly further attempt to make light of the controversy, there is a chain of coffee shops in the ''Grand Theft Auto IV'' game called "Hot Coffee Shop"
â
* In the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3 versions of ''Grand Theft Auto IV'', the Statue of Liberty is replaced with a Statue of Happiness, who holds a cup of coffee. The face on this statue intentionally resembles that of Senator Hilary Rodham Clinton. Note that the cup steams sometimes.
+
* In the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3 versions of ''Grand Theft Auto IV'', the Statue of Liberty is replaced with a Statue of Happiness, who holds a cup of coffee. The face on this statue intentionally resembles that of Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton. Note that the cup steams sometimes.
